body_html:
I was able to resolve it as i found out later that toco is not supported on windows !!
I had another issue while i tried converting the model on linux system. I ran theano in the backend which was accepting the image data in (number , channel , height , width)- NCHW was the input for the model and the core was dumped while conversion. On the other hand when i ran Tensorflow in backend (number , height,width, channel)-NHWC format the model was converted to tflite format .
SO while conversion make sure that you are

  1. running tensorflow in backend by:
    from keras import backend as K
    K.set_image_dim_ordering('tf'),
  2. install tf_nightly
    Hope it helps !!
body_text:
I was able to resolve it as i found out later that  toco is not supported on windows !!
I had another issue while i tried converting the model on linux system. I ran theano in the backend which was accepting the image data in (number , channel , height , width)- NCHW was the input for the model and the core was dumped while conversion. On the other hand when i ran Tensorflow in backend (number , height,width, channel)-NHWC format the model was converted to tflite format .
SO while conversion make sure that you are

running tensorflow in backend by:
from keras import backend as K
K.set_image_dim_ordering('tf'),
install tf_nightly
Hope it helps !!
body:
I was able to resolve it as i found out later that  toco is not supported on windows !!
I had another issue while i tried converting the model on linux system. I ran theano in the backend which was accepting the image data in (number , channel , height , width)- NCHW was the input for the model and the core was dumped while conversion. On the other hand when i ran Tensorflow in backend (number , height,width, channel)-NHWC format the model was converted to tflite format .
SO while conversion make sure that you are
1) running tensorflow in backend by:
from keras import backend as K
K.set_image_dim_ordering('tf'),
2) install tf_nightly
Hope it helps !!
